DM2.en:
Field 001 Record ID number [The field cannot be repeated]
  • a Record ID number (at the data producer)
  • b the data manufacturer's library number
  • c update time stamp (yyyymmddttmmss)
  • d first creation date (yyyymmdd)
  • e character set
  • f format
  • g filename
  • o Original format (machine-converted records)
  • t number system for ID number
Field 002 Former Faust number or decentralized ID number (DBC)
  • a former central faust number
  • b the data manufacturer's library number
  • c decentralized fist number
  • d other decentralized ID number
  • t number system for ID number in subfield *d or supplier code
  • x subfields b and c concatenated or b and d concatenated
Field 004 Record Status and Record Type Code [The field cannot be repeated]
  • r postal status code
  • a bibliographic record type code
  • n code for restrictions and the like.
  • x G code for auxiliary mail type
Field 005 Search codes for musicals and sound recordings [The field cannot be repeated]
  • h G code for accompanying material for musical works
  • i G code for score type
  • j G code for votes
  • k G code for musical notation
  • l G code for transposition and arrangement
  • r code for sound system
  • v code for radio / TV recording
  • z code for sound recording other than music and accompanying material
Field 006 Coded information about restrictions and restrictions on access to the registered material
  • a Release Date (yyyymmdd)
  • b Date of receipt of the material at the registering institution (yyyymmdd)
  • c Date of availability of the material (yyyymmdd)
  • d Age limit for lending
  • e Age-restricted recommendations
  • 2 Code of restriction rule
Field 008 General search codes for bibliographic materials [The field cannot be repeated]
  • t code for bibliographic category
  • u release status code
  • a year of publication
  • z subsequent year of publication
  • b G country of publication country code
  • c letter code for a periodic frequency
  • d G code for the form of the content
  • e code for public publication
  • f conference publication code
  • g code for party writing
  • h code for periodic type
  • i code for the main title alphabet or writing system
  • j code of fiction form
  • k code for biography
  • l code for main language
  • m code for large print
  • o code for children's or school materials
  • q G file type code
  • r code for the type of host publication
  • v catalog level code
  • w code for e-books
  • a code for the availability of online documents
  • x G Code for professional literature level
Field 009 Code for material designation [The field cannot be repeated]
  • a G code for general material designation (GMB)
  • b G code for supplementary general material designation
  • g G code for specific material designation
  • h G code for supplementary specific material designation
Field 010 DanBib ID number (DanBib) [The field cannot be repeated]
  • a danbib id number
  • b the data manufacturer's library number
  • c update time (yyyymmddttmmss)
  • d first creation date (yyyymmdd)
  • e character set
  • f format
  • g filename
  • t number system for ID number

Field 665 Indexing of Fiction (Reading Compass) Subfield Repeatable Name of subfield Value Note Examples
  • i G time indication Verbal time indication is given as text, while period indication for decade, century or millennium is given as two years separated by hyphens The earliest year is given first 665 *in the ice age, 665 *in the Middle Ages, 665 *in 1900-1909, 665 *in 299 -200 [time indication before our time reckoning]
  • q G geographical place name Text 665 *q Copenhagen, 665 *q Brooklyn Bridge, 665 *q Land’s End
  • p G fictitious place name Text 665 *p Langtbortistan, 665 *p Hogwarts
  • m G environment Text 665 *m the ¤creative class, 665 *m the wilderness
  • g G genre Text 665 *g crime, 665 *g genealogical novels
  • u G universe Text 665 *u magically realistic, 665 *u faction
  • e G topic Text 665 *e death, 665 *e friendship
  • h G main character category Text If more than one main character is specified, the field 665 *h tween, 665 *h wizard, 665 *h thing is repeated
  • j main character type Text Content in subfield t is a specification of content in subfield h and is related to it 665 *h thing *j balloon, 665 *h animal *j tiger
  • k G main character traits Text Content in subfield k relates to content in subfield h 665 *h thing *j balloon *k manipulative *k charming
  • l G main person conflict Text Content in subfield l relates to content in subfield h 665 *h things *j balloon *k manipulative *k charming *l itself *l society
  • f focus Code Code that reflects the relationship between plot (P), language (S), characters (K), environment (M) given as a percentage 665 *f (P) 30 (S) 10 (K) 30 (M) 30, 665 *f (P) 48 (S) 33 (K) 17 (M) 02
  • s G writing style Text 665 *s much dialogue, 665 *s open end
  • r G narrator voice Text 665 *r I-narrator, 665 *r changing points of view
  • t G tempo Text 665 *t lingering, 665 *t hoarse
  • n G mood Text 665 *n nostalgic, 665 *n sensual
  • a G note Text

RIS.da:
RIS Feltkode liste

 Links and references
Tag TY -- Type of reference (must be the first tag) (BOOK/JOUR/WEB/MULTI/COMP)
  • Field Name Reference Type
  • ABST Abstract
  • ADVS Audiovisual material
  • ART Art Work
  • BILL Bill/Resolution
  • BOOK Book, Whole
  • CASE Case
  • CHAP Book chapter
  • COMP Computer program
  • CONF Conference proceeding
  • CTLG Catalog
  • DATA Data file
  • ELEC Electronic Citation
  • GEN Generic
  • HEAR Hearing
  • ICOMM Internet Communication
  • INPR In Press
  • JFULL Journal (full)
  • JOUR Journal
  • MAP Map
  • MGZN Magazine article
  • MPCT Motion picture
  • MUSIC Music score
  • NEWS Newspaper
  • PAMP Pamphlet
  • PAT Patent
  • PCOMM Personal communication
  • RPRT Report
  • SER Serial (Book, Monograph)
  • SLIDE Slide
  • SOUND Sound recording
  • STAT Statute
  • THES Thesis/Dissertation
  • UNBILl Unenacted bill/resolution
  • UNPB Unpublished work
  • VIDEO Video recording
Tag ID -- Reference ID The Reference ID can consist of any alphanumeric characters—up to 20 characters in length.
  • DO -- DOI
  • DB -- Name of Database
  • DP -- Database Provider
  • LK -- Website Link
  • SN -- ISBN/ISSN
  • CN -- Call Number
  • UR -- URL
  • L4 -- Image(s). There is no practical limit to the length of this field.
  • L1 -- Link to PDF. There is no practical limit to the length of this field. URL addresses can be entered individually, one per tag or multiple addresses can be entered on one line using a semi-colon as a separator.
  • L2 -- Link to Full-text. There is no practical limit to the length of this field. URL addresses can be entered individually, one per tag or multiple addresses can be entered on one line using a semi-colon as a separator.
  • L3 -- Related Records. There is no practical limit to the length of this field.
Authors
Tag AU -- Author (each author on its own line preceded by the tag) The author name must be in the following syntax: Lastname, Firstname, Suffix For Firstname, you can use full names, initials, or both. The format for the author’s first name is as follows:
  • Phillips,A.J
  • Phillips,Albert John
  • Phillips,Albert
Types
  • Lastname = Any string of letters, spaces, and hyphens
  • Firstname = Any string of letters, spaces, and hyphens
  • Initial = Any single letter followed by a period
  • Full Name = Any string of letters, spaces, and hyphens
  • Suffix = Jr/Sr/II/III/MD etc. (Phillips,A.J.,Sr.); use of the suffix is optional
  • A1 -- First Author
  • A2 -- Secondary Author (each author on its own line preceded by the tag)
  • A3 -- Tertiary Author (each author on its own line preceded by the tag)
  • A4 -- Subsidiary Author (each author on its own line preceded by the tag)
  • AD -- Author Address
  • ED -- Editor
  • TA -- Translated Author
    • Titles
    • TI -- Title
    • T1 -- Primary Title
    • T2 -- Secondary Title (journal title, if applicable)
    • T3 -- Tertiary Title
    • TT -- Translated Title
    • ST -- Short Title
    • CT -- Title of unpublished reference
    • CA -- Caption
    Journal
    Tag JA -- Periodical name: standard abbreviation. This is the periodical in which the article was (or is to be, in the case of in-press references) published. This is an alphanumeric field of up to 255 characters. If possible, periodical names should be abbreviated in the Index Medicus style, with periods after the abbreviations. If this is not possible (your large bibliography file in WordPerfect has no periods after abbreviations), you can use the "RIS Format (Adds periods)" Import Filter definition. This definition uses the Periodical Word Dictionary.
    • IS -- Issue number
    • J1 -- Periodical name: user abbreviation 1. This is an alphanumeric field of up to 255 characters.
    • J2 -- Alternate Title (this field is used for the abbreviated title of a book or journal name, the latter mapped to T2)
    • JF -- Journal/Periodical name: full format. This is an alphanumeric field of up to 255 characters.
    • JO -- Journal/Periodical name: full format. This is an alphanumeric field of up to 255 characters.
    • VL -- Volume number
    Collation
    • CY -- Place Published
    • DA -- Date
    • EP -- End Page
    • ET -- Edition
    • NV -- Number of Volumes
    • OP -- Original Publication
    • PB -- Publisher
    • PP -- Publishing Place
    Tag PY -- Publication year (YYYY)
    • YYYY/MM/DD/other info
    The year, month and day fields are all numeric. The other info field can be any string of letters, spaces and hyphens. Note that each specific date information is optional, however the slashes ("/") are not. For example, if you just had the and , then the output would look like: "1998///Spring."
    • Y1 -- Primary Date
    • Y2 -- Access Date
    • RI -- Reviewed Item
    Tag RP -- Reprint Edition (ON REQUEST/NOT IN FILE/ON REQUEST (MM/DD/YY) ) This optional field can contain one of three status notes. Each must be in uppercase, and the date after "ON REQUEST" must be in the US date format, in parentheses: (MM/DD/YY).
    If this field is blank in your downloaded text file, the import function assumes the reprint status is “NOT IN FILE.”
    The three options are:
    • IN FILE - This is for references that you have a physical copy of in your files.
    • NOT IN FILE - This is for references that you do not have physical copies of in your files.
    • ON REQUEST (MM/DD/YY) - This means that you have sent for a reprint of the reference; the date is the date on which the reprint was requested (in MM/DD/YY format).
  • SE -- Section
  • SP -- Start Page
  • VO -- Published Standard number
  • LA -- Language
  • LB -- Label
  • M1 -- Number
    • Keywords
    Tag KW -- Keywords (keywords should be entered each on its own line preceded by the tag) Each keyword or phrase must be on its own line, preceded by this tag. A keyword can consist of multiple words (phrases) and can be up to 255 characters long. There is no limit to the amount of keywords in a single reference.
    Abstracts
    • AB -- Abstract
    • N1 -- Notes
    • N2 -- Abstract. This is a free text field and can contain alphanumeric characters. There is no practical length limit to this field.
    • BT -- This field maps to T2 for all reference types except for Whole Book and Unpublished Work references. It can contain alphanumeric characters. There is no practical limit to the length of this field.
    • RN -- Research Notes
    Localisation and shelfmark
    • AN -- Accession Number
    • AV -- Location in Archives
    Custom / user defined
    • C1 -- Custom 1
    • C2 -- Custom 2
    • C3 -- Custom 3
    • C4 -- Custom 4
    • C5 -- Custom 5
    • C6 -- Custom 6
    • C7 -- Custom 7
    • C8 -- Custom 8
    • U1 -- User definable 1. This is an alphanumeric field and there is no practical limit to the length of this field.
    • U2 -- User definable 2. This is an alphanumeric field and there is no practical limit to the length of this field.
    • U3 -- User definable 3. This is an alphanumeric field and there is no practical limit to the length of this field.
    • U4 -- User definable 4. This is an alphanumeric field and there is no practical limit to the length of this field.
    • U5 -- User definable 5. This is an alphanumeric field and there is no practical limit to the length of this field.
    Other
    • CP -- This field can contain alphanumeric characters. There is no practical limit to the length of this field.
    • M2 -- Miscellaneous 2. This is an alphanumeric field and there is no practical limit to the length of this field.
    • M3 -- Type of Work
    • ER -- End of Reference (must be empty and the last tag)
